CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 3, 1966, pg. 13A, reads: "Daughters of Isis - When Sahara Court 9, Daughters of Isis entertained friends at their third annual Ball recently, the group honored two of their members. Held in ballroom of the Pick - Roosevelt Hotel, honorees were Past Commandress Cornell Queen and Illustrious Commandress Anna M. Washington, Dignitaries seated from left, Noble Carl Russell, advisor; Daughters Virginia Goggin, Deputy of Oasis; Mrs. Washington, honoree; Mrs. Queen, honoree, and Hazel Bradford, Deputy of Desert (State).  Second row: Daughter Betty Culbertson, Elfrieda Patterson, Laura Walker, Evelyn Christian, Mary Taylor, Gertrude Russell, Ruth Tucker, Natalie Green, Fannie Maynor, Lois Lee - Dorsey, Martha Grimes, Mildred Brown, Mabel Griffin, Marion Gooden and Marguerite Smart, publicity chairman.  Last row: Daughters Eugenis Catlin, co-chairman; Olive Smith, Irene Johnson, Henrietta Forrest, Tillie Larkin, Alberta Finch Hargrove, general chairman; Cathy Maddox Milton, Sarah Austin, Romayne Moody, Mildred Johnson and Virginia Cohen. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of man wearing Sahara fez and tuxedo, and thirty women from Daughters of Isis, Sahara Court nine, wearing light colored gowns and fezzes, posed in Roosevelt Hotel for annual ball
